Step 4: Transform and extrude the 2D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch along its normal with a depth of 0.1021 units. Part 2 Instructions Shape: Cylindrical object with a tapered end (resembling a cone) Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0781, 0.0616] Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. The sketch should consist of a single face (face\\_1) containing a loop (loop\\_1) made up of a single circle: - Circle 1: Center = [0.0247, 0.0247], Radius = 0.0247 Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale = 0.0495. Step 4: Transform and extrude (cut) the 2D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch in the opposite direction of its normal with a depth of 0.132 units, effectively creating a cut. This will result in a cylindrical shape with a tapered end. Final Shape: Rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side After completing Parts 1 and 2, the final assembly should be composed of the respective parts. The first part is the rectangular prism (with a flat top and bottom), and the second part is the cylindrical object with a tapered end (resembling a cone). The parts are combined based on the instructions in the "assembly JSON", which may include JoinFeatureOperation, CutFeatureOperation, or other boolean operations.</description>
